metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4070 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
** DISPUTED ** Integer overflow in the php_raw_url_encode function inext/standard/url.c in PHP before 5.5.34, 5.6.x before 5.6.20, and 7.xbefore 7.0.5 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(application crash) via a long string to the rawurlencode function. NOTE:the vendor says "Not sure if this qualifies as security issue (probablynot)."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4070` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.16
libapache2-mod-php5filter - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.16
libphp5-embed - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.16
php-pear - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.16
php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.16
php5-cgi - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.16

No subscription required

criterions.comment: php5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.16').
